meanings.definition: To swarm or be crowded with bees or other insects.
meanings.sent1: The garden would beswarm with bees during the summer months.
meanings.sent2: The picnic area was beswarmed with ants after the food was left out.
meanings.sent3: The flower shop accidentally beswarmed with bees when they left the door open.
meanings.sent4: The field beswarmed with insects, creating a buzzing blanket of activity.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the meadow began to beswarm with fireflies, lighting up the night.

meanings.definition: To be filled or crowded with a large number of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The stadium would beswarm with fans during the championship game.
meanings.sent2: The shopping mall was beswarmed with shoppers during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The classroom accidentally beswarmed with students after the fire alarm went off.
meanings.sent4: The city streets beswarmed with protesters, demanding change.
meanings.sent5: The park would beswarm with families on weekends, enjoying picnics and games.
